newsitem.title: INDIA: India and Sweden sign tax evasion agreement.
newsitem.headline: India and Sweden sign tax evasion agreement.

text.p: India and Sweden on Tuesday signed an agreement to avoid double taxation and prevent tax evasion.
Indian junior Finance Minister Satpal Maharaj and Swedish Minister of Taxation Thomas Ostros signed the agreement in the Indian capital, the government said in a statement.
The agreement, which replaces a 1988 convention, seeks to boost the two-way flow of investment, technology, trade and services between the two countries, it said.
The accord provides for lower tax rates compared with India's rates on interest, royalties and fees for technical services.
Under the agreement, each country will assist the other in collecting taxes. The countries will share information to prevent fraud and tax evasion, it added.
